metadata.Name: Vibravox
metadata.Description: Vibravox is a dataset containing audio recordings using five different body-conduction audio sensors and an airborne microphone. It includes 45 hours per sensor of speech samples and physiological sounds recorded by 188 participants under different acoustic conditions.
Provider: Conservatoire National des Arts et Métiers (Cnam)
metadata.Paper Title: Vibravox: A Dataset of French Speech Captured with Body-conduction Audio Sensors
metadata.Venue Title: IEEE Transactions on Audio, Speech, and Language Processing
metadata.Venue Name: IEEE Transactions on Audio, Speech, and Language Processing
Affiliations: Laboratoire de Mécanique des Structures et des Systèmes Couplés, Conservatoire national des arts et métiers
Department of Acoustics and Soldier Protection, French-German Research Institute of Saint-Louis (ISL)
metadata.Abstract: Vibravox is a dataset compliant with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) containing audio recordings using five different body-conduction audio sensors: two in-ear microphones, two bone conduction vibration pickups, and a laryngophone. The dataset also includes audio data from an airborne microphone used as a reference. The Vibravox corpus contains 45 hours per sensor of speech samples and physiological sounds recorded by 188 participants under different acoustic conditions imposed by a high order ambisonics 3D spatializer. Annotations about the recording conditions and linguistic transcriptions are also included in the corpus.
